meanings.sent1: The deme of squirrels in the park is thriving.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study how demes of birds interact in the forest.
meanings.sent3: The deme of ants held a meeting to discuss their food sources.
meanings.sent4: The deme of fish in the pond swam together like a synchronized team.
meanings.sent5: The deme of flowers in the garden added vibrant colors to the landscape.

meanings.definition: A political subdivision in ancient Greece
meanings.sent1: The deme of Athens played a crucial role in the city-state.
meanings.sent2: Citizens in each deme had specific responsibilities in governance.
meanings.sent3: The deme elections were filled with excitement and debates.
meanings.sent4: The deme boundaries marked the territories of different groups.
meanings.sent5: The deme festivals celebrated the unique culture of each region.

meanings.sent1: She will deme the candies equally among the children.
meanings.sent2: The teacher will deme the tasks based on each student's ability.
meanings.sent3: He decided to deme his time between work and hobbies.
meanings.sent4: The chef will deme the ingredients into separate bowls for the recipe.
meanings.sent5: The manager will deme the workload to ensure efficiency in the team.
